resources.string: Proverbs
\"Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be One.\"
\"It never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinion than our own\".
\"It’s not because things are difficult that we dare not venture. It’s because we dare not venture that they are difficult.\"
\"You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.\"
\“Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.\”
\“If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?\”
\“Having the fewest wants, I am nearest to the gods.\”
\“What upsets people is not things themselves, but their judgements about these things.\”
\“How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself.\”
\“First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.\”
\“Anything or anyone capable of angering you becomes your master.”\
\"It is better to live in a desert than with a quarrelsome and nagging wife.\"
\"A hot-tempered person stirs up conflict, but the one who is patient calms a quarrel.\"
\"Do you see a person wise in their own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for them.\"
\"The rich are wise in their own eyes; one who is poor and discerning sees how deluded they are.\"
\"Wounds from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy multiplies kisses.\"
\"A fool’s lips walk into a fight, and his mouth invites a beating.\"
\"Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but whoever hates correction is stupid.\"
\"Whoever disregards discipline comes to poverty and shame, but whoever heeds correction is honored.\"
\"Do not wear yourself out to get rich; do not trust your own cleverness.\"
\"Do you see someone skilled in their work? They will serve before kings; they will not serve before obscure men.\"
\"To acquire wisdom is to love oneself; people who cherish understanding will prosper.\" (Proverbs 19:8)
\"A fool shows his annoyance at once, but a prudent person overlooks an insult.\" (Proverbs 12:16)
\"The rich rule over the poor, and the borrower is slave to the lender.\" (Proverbs 22:7)
\"Sluggards do not plow in season; so at harvest time they look but find nothing.\" (Proverbs 20:4)
\"A false witness will not go unpunished, and whoever pours out lies will not go free.\" (Proverbs 19:5)
\"Whoever trusts in his own mind is a fool, but he who walks in wisdom will be delivered.\" (Proverbs 28:26)
\"Do not say, ‘I’ll pay you back for this wrong!’ Wait for the Lord, and He will avenge you.\" (Proverbs 20:22)
\"When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom.\" (Proverbs 11:2)
\"A generous person will prosper; whoever refreshes others will be refreshed.\" (Proverbs 11:25)
